subject: AI & Agents
title: Model Serving Patterns: Batch vs Real-Time
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Model Serving Patterns: Batch vs Real-Time.

hook.text: Recommendation scores at midnight for all users vs instant fraud detection per transaction.

buildup.text: Batch serving precomputes predictions on a schedule. Real-time serves per request.

discovery.text: Batch: high throughput, no latency constraint. Real-time: low latency, lower throughput.

twist.text: Many systems use both: batch for 90% of predictions, real-time for the rest.

climax.text: Choose based on freshness requirements: stale data OK â†’ batch, milliseconds matter â†’ real-time.

punchline.text: Not everything needs to be real-time. Not everything can wait.

quiz.question: When should you use batch serving?
options: When predictions don't need to be real-time
When the model is very small
